intro: Dischidiopsis mariae, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
